Description: Collar: composed of sixty-four long thin cylinders of green with some blue glazed composition strung vertically to form a collar. The beads are graded in size, the shortest at the ends. From the longest cylinder at the centre hangs a green glazed composition amulet of indeterminate shape; it is possibly just a notched cylinder. At each end of the collar is strung a green glazed composition oblate bead.
Curator's comments: Cf. G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), pl.LXXVI, type 12. Also from this burial: beads (1969,0212.33), necklaces (1969,0212.31 & 1969,0212.32). Bibliography: W.V.Davies (ed.), 'Egypt and Africa : Nubia from prehistory to Islam' (London, 1991), [PL.7,3].
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (648)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands
